text:
FgSegNet? I want to build one. At the moment I have a starting point here <https://towardsdatascience.com/foreground-image-segmentation-with-fgsegnet-9ecbe3d194ab|https://towardsdatascience.com/foreground-image-segmentation-with-fgsegnet-9ecbe3d194ab> 
I guess Flux would be a good tool for this. Is there any example code that I could take and tweak?

attachments.title: Foreground Image Segmentation with FgSegNet
attachments.text: A multi-scale CNN with an autoencoder-like architecture
attachments.fallback: Medium: Foreground Image Segmentation with FgSegNet

I guess Flux would be a good tool for this. Is there any example code that I could take and tweak?

text: You can find many segmentation algs, Metalhaed.jl, Unet.jl, ObjectDetector.jl. there are style transfer models, GANs etc

text: Doesn't look too hard to stand up from scratch tbh
